sen: palette_type == GIMP_CUSTOM_PALETTE)

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
"(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: switch (dither_type)

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: Thanks.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: That's interesting.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: I expect it to yield poorer results though, to some extent (probably most obviously darker, or lighter, in mid-greys, that is a damaged gamma), because the greyscale colour-matching and error-quantifying is in a comparatively non-perceptually-uniform space (that's half the reason why it's faster, though it's not as big a quality difference in a greyscale source as an RGB source).

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: Were side-by-side comparisons done?

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: I hope so, though I could do some here if anyone cares.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: I don't think anyone has done side-by-side comparisons.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: differences, but not so strong that I'm really going to lose any sleep.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: Note that the analysis in comment #1 is correct;

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: the 'optimal' palette finder does a first pass to see if there are already a suitable number of colours, and then knows that it can skip both the expensive quantization and dithering stages.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: The 'mono' palette option doesn't even bother to start this pre-pass because it could only possibly pay off the extra effort if the entire image is pure black and pure white, which is expected to be a comparatively rare occurance.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: > The 'mono' palette option doesn't even bother to start this pre-pass because it could only possibly pay off the extra effort if the entire image is pure black and pure white, which is expected to be a comparatively rare occurance.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: I don't think that this operation is so rare, because for getting an \"optimal distribution between black and white\" for grayscale images (for example: you want to generate faximilies the receiver actually is able to read), you use the

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: \"threshold\" operation, and then a \"convert to 1bit\" operation to actually adjust the internal memory requirements.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: So at least for me, this chain of operations is rather frequent.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: > and then a \"convert to 1bit\" operation to actually adjust the internal memory requirements.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: If you mean GIMP's internal memory requirements you're wasting your time -- all Indexed images are 8/16bpp internally (the same as greyscale images), so you're not saving any memory (instead you may be using quite a lot more, for various

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: reasons).

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: I mean OpenOffice's internal memory requirements.

title: "(170801) GIMP - Converting image from grayscale to black&white is painfully slow"
sen: For having 10 or 20 fax pages in one OOo document, it quite makes a difference wether they are 8bit or 1bit.

sen: Please describe the problem:

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: When going to File->Acquire->Screenshot in the Windows port of the development build GIMP 2.3.11, firstly there are two different entries \"Screen Shot\" and \"Screenshot\" and secondly, functionality to grab only a portion of the screen is broken.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: There is no option to \"Select a Region to Grab\" when the user chooses \"Screen Shot.\"

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: However, this option exists in the dialogue box that appears after the user selects :Screenshot.\"

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: However, the functionality does not work, even after selecting a long delay period.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Instead, the whole screen is captured each time.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: I was expecting the mouse cursor onscreen to change to \"crosshairs\" or something similar to allow me to select the region I required.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Steps to reproduce:

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: 1. Launch GIMP 2.3.11 Development for Windows on a Windows 2000 platform.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: 2. Got o File->Acquire->Screenshot.  (Note the two different entries for \"Screen Shot\" and \"Screenshot\".)

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: 3. Tick \"Select a Region to Grab.\"

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: 4.  Set the delay.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: 5.  Click \"Grab.\"

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Actual results:

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: The whole screen is captured each time.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Expected results:

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: The ability to select a portion of the screen would be available, probably via mouse click-and-drag functionality.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Does this happen every time?

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Yes.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Other information:

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: (I presume the two entries for screenshots under the submenu are there in order to test old and new code, by the way but I just noted it in case there was an issue.)

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: D. Le Sage

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: APF

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Hobart, Tasmania

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: We know that the port of the screenshot plug-in for Windows is incomplete.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: What's this bug-report about?

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Do you want to contribute the missing bits or do you want us to disable the plug-in for the Windows platform?

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: We are waiting for a volunteer to implement the missing functionality for more than a year now.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Perhaps it's about time to drop support for the Win32 platform completely.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Sven,

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: The bug report was to alert you in case you did not know it was broken.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: You are obviously aware it is incomplete.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Perhaps you should disable it to prevent more questions from users.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: I am not a programmer so I cannot implement the functionality.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: I am trying to do my part by reporting issues for you.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: You have complained before about how short of volunteers you are.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: If this is the case, perhaps it is a very good idea to drop support for Win32 and consolidate on making sure the *Nix implementation is as good as possible.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Supporting Win32 is probably just draining more resources away.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: IIRC Tor is working on this.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: apf, you are using a development version.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Of course there are incomplete and even broken features in there.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: If you are just a user, you should be using the stable release.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: Tor said that it is impossible to implement the look and feel of the X11 screenshot plug-in on the Windows platform.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"
sen: He suggested that we stick with Winsnap for the Win32.

title: "(364852) GIMP - screenshot plug-in incomplete for Windows platform"

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Please describe the problem:

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: When I try to export reports that contain graphs gnuCash just creates an empty html file.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Also it is not clear that the export can only do html files.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: The first time I ran export I triped to save as .jpg and it created a html file named foo.jpg

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Steps to reproduce:

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: 1. In gnuCash go on reports and create any report that contains a graph

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: 2. In the report window click on Export

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: 3. Save export to \"foo.html\"

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Actual results:

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: An empty HTML file is saved

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Expected results:

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: A HTML file with a nice graph

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Does this happen every time?

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Yes

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Other information:

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Yes, that's true -- the current graphing code, which uses the graphical library \"Guppi\" which is a dead project, can only produce the on-screen diagrams *and* print these to postscript, but it cannot export these diagrams into pictures that are embedded in a HTML-file.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: In other words, you can only print the diagrams to postscript but not export them to HTML.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: This is not going to change before the gnome2 port is completed, because we need to switch to a different graphical library before anything related to this can be changed.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: See http://gnomesupport.org/wiki/index.php/GnuCashPortingStatus for the porting status.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Definitely keep it as a reminder.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: We should be able to coax anything into giving us a PNG; GOG supports SVG export, too.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: But it looks like gtkhtml doesn't support saving <object /> data.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Because it sucks ass.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: This is still valid for me with version 2.0.4 on opensuse 10.2.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: This is a real problem not to be able to export these reports.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: This shouldn't be tagged 'enhancement' anymore, but brought up higher.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: What's the status on this?

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Thank you.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: (In reply to comment #4)

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: > This is still valid for me with version 2.0.4 on opensuse 10.2.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: > This is a real > problem not to be able to export these reports.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: > This shouldn't be tagged 'enhancement' anymore, but brought up higher.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: > What's the status on this?

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: There's no change on this.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: I wonder if the more recent gtkhtml supports getting at <object />s, or if the more recent GOG makes it trivial to create a PNG.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: In any case, I hesitate to do so, but I've raised the severity to Normal -- a minor part of the component (Reports, export, graphs) does not work.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: (FWIW, Fred, it's not going to get fixed any faster at Normal than at Enhancement.)

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: I can confirm this using GnuCash 2.0.5 on Ubuntu 7.04, feisty fawn...and I can confirm that it's frustrating....

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: 2.2.8, still doesn't have this needed feature... Frustration also confirmed.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: GtkHtml provides a callback when it encounters a <object> tag, and gnc-html then calls gog to create the image as a GdkPixbuf and then embed it in the web page.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: For the webkit port, there is no <object> callback.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Therefore, gnc-html-webkit pre-parses the html string, finds the <object> tag, calls gog with the parameter values from the <object> to create a GdkPixbuf, then converts the pixels to png/base64 and embeds the html <img> in the original

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: where the <object> was.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Result is a graph that displays in webkit.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: In addition, gnc-html-webkit saves the html passed to webkit and handles the export itself by writing that html to a file.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: This fix is targetted for 2.4.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: I can also convert gnc-html-gtkhtml to use these two features (convert graph to embedded <img> and do the export rather

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: than getting gtkhtml to do it) for those who can't build 2.4 with webkit.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: It turns out that gtkhtml (at least the version I have on Ubuntu 9.04) doesn't support inline images.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: Therefore, this will only be possible using webkit.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: The gnucash-1.8.x series is no longer developed.

title: "(168803) GnuCash - Exporting Reports with graphs"
sen: We may keep this enhancement request as a reminder, though.

sen: The delete issue reported in the first post might be related to bug #528347, where client apps using GIO/GVFS are unable see dot-files which are blocking directory removal as it's not empty.

title: "(522933) gvfs - copying or deleting a directory leads to a file not available error"
sen: Otherwise deleting whole directory structure works fine in Nautilus and backend reports G_IO_ERROR_NOT_EMPTY correctly.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: According to Havoc:

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: If you need struct fields in any widget, please file a bug report,  they should never be required to use a widget.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Accordingly, I took a look at the places where the latest PyGtk wrappers directly access widget data attributes to provide needed functionality.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: I found 43 examples, identified in the table below.

sen: (Of course, there may be more that PyGtk doesn't use or expose.)

sen: Most of these data attributes are accessed directly to provide them to the Python programmer.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Some of them are bogus and already  have accessor functions, I believe:

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: GTK_BIN                         child

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: GTK_CHECK_MENU_ITEM             active

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: GTK_TEXT_BUFFER                 tag_table

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Also, most of them are for deprecated widgets.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: But there are many there we should probably have functions for.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Adding API keyword, but putting on future milestone.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: When considering accessor functions, you might also want to consider raising the API up to a bit higher level.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: For example, the Combo widget should probably have its own value-changed signal and direct access to the underlying entry and list widgets should be deprecated with some higher level functions written for the Combo widget to get at necessary functionality.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Since the GtkList widget is already deprecated, this stuff is going to break in applications someday anyway.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: No kidding about the breakability in the combo box: this is already pretty much broken in GTK-- (C++ binding), where they use a different implementation for the (deprecated) list, which basically makes it impossible to access list data.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: A change in the GTK+ API to allow access to the list items through a function would make this a whole lot more usable.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Suggestion:

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Make the list in the combo a GList.

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: This would also make working with the combo easier...

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: Not sure if there's a good way of handling arbitary  widgets with associated text without creating some sort of ListItem

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: (deprecated) replacement...

title: "(64222) GTK - Access to data elements of many widgets required"
sen: The ongoing gseal work is finally taking care of this.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: The gtk_show_help function is missing |return ret;|.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: You forgot to add the new funcs to gtk/gtk.symbols .

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: + * modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: + * License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: + * version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: There is no \"Lesser GPL version 2\".

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: It's the Lesser GPL version 2.1 (or the Library GPL version 2).

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Somehow I feel that gtk_show_help() is too GNOME oriented to be included in this form.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: I have been told that gtk_show_uri() will work nicely on the major supported platforms.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: This is hwoever not the case for gtk_show_help().

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Since the functionality of gtk_show_help() can be easily implemented on top of gtk_show_uri(), it should be sufficient to provide gtk_show_uri() for now.

sen: What's the consensus on this?

sen: Can I commit gtkshow.c to gtk+ when I remove gtk_show_help?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"

sen: Patch removing gtk_show_help

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Can one of the maintainers decided what to do with this patch? Thanks

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: gtk_show_uri allows a NULL parent, but that is not multi-head safe.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Why not take a mandatory GdkScreen argument since the function couldn't care less about the parent widget beyond its screen?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: I can make it such that the parent has to be set mandatory.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Having a GtkWidget *parent saves calling a gtk_widget_get_screen everytime you do a gtk_show_uri

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: What's the opinion on this of others?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: I don't think the parent should be mandatory, because there are situations

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: where they may not be a parent at all.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: A mandatory parent would be bad, as Ross explained in comment #11.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: IMO the best solution is to change the function to take a GdkScreen instead of a parent widget.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Shouldn't hurt much to call gtk_widget_get_screen().

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Created an attachment (id=107888) [details]

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Updated gtk_show_uri patch now using a GdkScreen as input

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Thanks for you comments.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Any more comments?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Ping. Can above patch be applied?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Can one of the maintainers make a decision about this patch.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Thanks

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Some comments:

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: - Wrt to the parent issue, I think the function should accept NULL there.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Being forced to call gdk_widget_get_screen() is annoyance, when  GdkAppLaunchContext handles unset screen already.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: - The documentation needs to go in some more detail about what kind of 'uri' this function accepts.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: There is no standard for this, unfortunately, and the gnome-vfs->gio transition has unearthed a number of problems due to this.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: - I'd be interested in a function that mounts the volume before opening it.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: This is what e.g. the panel needs (see bug 529243 ).

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: That could be a separate function, or gtk_uri_show could take flags.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Created an attachment (id=109974) [details]

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Updated patch. GdkScreen can be NULL

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Matthias, thanks for the review.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: I've updated the patch with your first two comments.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: About the third comment (the auto mounting).

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Why would gtk_show_uri need extra flags for this?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: We could add code that just tries to mount if this is necessary.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Your patch in bug 529243 uses libgnomeui/gnome-password-dialog.h which can't be used in gtk+

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: What do you want to do?

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Commit this patch (quite some apps could reduce their dependency on libgnomeui and friends already) and later on add the mounting part

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Matthias: being forced to call gdk_widget_get_screen is a good thing as it avoids multiscreen bugs.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: If GdkAppLaunchContext handles it, as you say, that sounds like that ought to be fixed too.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: There really is no way the gdk/gtk layer can know what screen should be used.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: OK, this bug report has gotten silly.</monty-python>

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: In 99% of use cases, the user interacts with some widget, and as a result, the program wants to show a URI on the same screen as that widget.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: In 99% of the remaining 1% of use cases, the program has no opinion at all about what screen to show the URI on (eg, gnome-open), and so it's going to pass NULL for parent regardless of whether parent is a GtkWidget or a GtkScreen.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: (Or in the mandatory GtkScreen case, it would always call gdk_screen_get_default().)

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Given that this is a 10-line function, it seems silly to make its interface less convenient for 99% of users just so it can cover an additional 0.01% of use cases.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Assuming there actually are programs that need to show URIs on specific screens that do not correspond to any live widget, the developers of those programs can just cut and paste the gtk_show_uri source and change it accordingly.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: accordingly.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Jaap: the way to handle mounting in GTK+ is to use a GtkMountOperation.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: I'm not 100% happy with the single-function header gtkshow.h, but I don't really have a better alternative.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: It is probably ok to commit it in this form now, we'll figure out the mounting later.

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: Thanks for the review. It's now committed

title: "(514396) GTK - Add gtk_show_uri"
sen: 2008-05-25  Jaap A. Haitsma  <jaap@haitsma.org>

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: The group title should be pronouced before radio buttons or other controls.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: It is not, this is bug since blid users cannont know what the group content is dealing about.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Interesting.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Both Window-Eyes and JAWS will read a Group title IF the Group has a single child that does not have an obvious name, for example, a text or a list or a combo box.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: But neither screen reader will read a Group title if it groups a set of radio buttons or check boxes, say.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: (Or, I assume, if it is surrounding something that has an obvious label to read instead, like a button, and if the child control takes focus).

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: We have several dialogs - notably, the search and find/replace dialogs, that have groups with radio/checkbox children.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: The screen readers do not read the group titles in these dialogs.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: I will bring this to the attention of the screen reader developers.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: For now, an extreme, but sort-of useable work-around in Window-Eyes is to tell it to read every control in a newly-opened dialog.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: You can do this with:

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Global -> Verbosity -> Activated... Entire Window if Dialog

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: CCing Frank and Lin.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Here are 2 examples of eclipse dialogs where a group title is not read:

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: 1) Click on the flashlight (Search) tool in the main toolbar.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Click on any of the tabs in the notebook.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: All of the pages have a \"Scope\" group.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Some of the pages have a \"Search For\" group or a \"Limit To\" group.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: None of these titles are read by JAWS.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: 2) Open an editor on any file, and then select Edit -> Find/Replace... (or type ctrl+F) to get the Find/Replace dialog.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: The \"Direction\", \"Scope\", and \"Options\" group titles are never read.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: I think the best thing would be if these were read when one of the radio or checkbox controls gets focus (i.e. when the dialog is activated, and when the user tabs to a new group or clicks on a control in another group.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Today, Frank and Lin tested with JAWS 5.0, 5.1 and 6.0 beta, we found both the dialogue from flashlight and Find/Replace from the Edit group titles are spoken correctly.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Created an attachment (id=14333) [details]

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"

sen: It is not working for me, so either I didn't make the problem clear enough, or you have some JAWS settings set that I do not have set.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: I just installed JAWS 5.1, and in the installation process, it asked if I wanted to keep settings from my previous JAWS version.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: I said \"No\", because I want my JAWS 5.1 to be \"out-of-the-box\". So I have NO settings in my JAWS 5.1, so no surprises.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: After further investigation, we determined that the problem only happens on Windows XP with the javaw.exe.manifest installed in jre/bin (this tells WinXP to use the WinXP common controls - version 6.0 - instead of the Win2K common

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: controls - version 5.x).

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: This problem is solved in JAWS.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: The window class for this object has been reassigned internally in JAWS.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: This fix will be reflected in JAWS version 6.0 which is due out shortly.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Verified that this now works in JAWS 6.0.

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: Thank-you, Frank!

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: *** Bug 51963 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

title: "(69350) Eclipse - Accessibility : Group title is not taken into account by Window-Eyes 4.5"
sen: close

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"

sen: The stack does not show any participation of teneo.

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"
sen: I tested it on a complete new eclipse (RCP version) installation (M20080221-1800 ) with the EMF, GEF and GMF features installed in an empty workspace.

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"
sen: After each installation I looked at the that \"Ant Home Entries\" entry and all was fine.

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"

title: "(226688) Eclipse - Teneo installation corrupts Ant installation"

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The releng test have been DNF for the last couple builds. Running locally we occasionally see crashes in the BrowserTests so we suspect these crashes to be the cause of the DNF.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Created an attachment (id=135853) [details]

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Pushing this fix for RC2, as it's too risky to make this change for RC1 now.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: For RC1 we'll comment out the crashing tests so that the other tests can run properly.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: We have NOT seen this bug affect the usability of Eclipse, only the running of the SWT test suite.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The problem is that the strategy we use to release pools periodically (in readAndDispatch, createWidget, etc) to be able to run the test suites, releases the main thread pool created be Device and stored in a thread local dictionary.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The pool was not removed from the thread local dictionary and got reused the next time a display was created.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The new strategy is to only release the main thread pool when the device count goes to zero.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Obviously, something this low level needs as much testing as it can get.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Can we get a test build run to verify all tests pass/no crashes/no OOM/etc?

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Also, you should be doing the two day test pass on a version of SWT that includes the change.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Created an attachment (id=136083) [details]

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: new fix

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The new fix is simpler, we just make sure the the pool in the thread dictionary is always valid, that way when another display is created it will not use a released pool.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: There was a further problem where the pool was released too early.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: If we are in call in, we cannot released the top of the stack pool.

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: The tests that where showing this problem have been put back (just in HEAD).

title: "(276131) Eclipse - Browser Test crashing"
sen: Fixed > 20090515

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; fr-FR; rv:1.8.1.13) Gecko/20080311 Iceweasel/2.0.0.13 (Debian-2.0.0.13-1)

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Build Identifier: 0.8 (2008033118)

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: When a calendar to which I am subscribed no longer exists, Lightning will try indefinitely to reach it and use 100% of my CPU. This, despite the 404 results it receives.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Reproducible: Always

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Steps to Reproduce:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: 1. create a calendar on your server

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: 2. subscribe to it via Lightning

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: 3. quit Thunderbird

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: 4. erase the calendar from your server

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: 5. relaunch Thunderbird

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Actual Results:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: A propfind is executed on the resource, resulting in a 404 error code.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: An OPTION on the parent directory occurs, with a 200 result.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Then the loop continues with a new propfind...

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Expected Results:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: I would expect Lightning to stop trying to reach the calendar collection as

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: soon as it receives the 404 result.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: When using the display of source and destination ip/port in tcpflow, I notice the Lightning side always has a different port, which leads me to think that many connections are occuring at the same time.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: The problem occurs when safeRefresh() is called from calDavCalendar.js.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: In there, we have the following condition:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: if (!this.mCtag || !this.mFirstRefreshDone) {

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: var refreshEvent = this.prepRefresh();

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: this.getUpdatedItems(refreshEvent, aChangeLogListener);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: return;

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
"(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: this.mFirstRefreshDone is false because since the calendar was removed, we never got a chance to complete the call to getCalendarData() nor checkDavResourceType() (see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=463961 for that one...).

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: So, we'll enter into an infinite loop because getUpdatedItems() calls right at the beginning checkDavResourceType() since the calendar was marked as disabled.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: But, checkDavResourceType() doesn't check for the 404 error code.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: We have:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: var str = convertByteArray(aResult, aResultLength);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: if (!str) {

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: dump(\"CalDAV: Failed to determine resource type\");

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: thisCalendar.completeCheckServerInfo(aChangeLogListener,

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
"(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Components.interfaces.calIErrors.DAV_NOT_DAV);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: return;

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: } else if (thisCalendar.verboseLogging()) {

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: dump(\"CalDAV: recv: \" + str);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
"(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: and we should rather have something like:

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: var str = convertByteArray(aResult, aResultLength);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: if (!str || aContext.responseStatus == 404) {

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: dump(\"CalDAV: Failed to determine resource type\");

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: thisCalendar.completeCheckServerInfo(aChangeLogListener,

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
"(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Components.interfaces.calIErrors.DAV_NOT_DAV);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: return;

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: } else if (thisCalendar.verboseLogging()) {

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: dump(\"CalDAV: recv: \" + str);

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
"(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: This cause checkDavResourceType() to (incorrectly) continue its processing, which will cause a call to completeCheckServerInfo() with a success code and then again, a call to safeRefresh(), creating an infite loop for cached calendars.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Created an attachment (id=363577) [details]

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Proposed fix

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: This bug is critical in order to avoid an endless loop and also in order to avoid generating _tons_ of HTTP requests to the CalDAV server (up to 10-20 per second).

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: (From update of attachment 363577 [details])

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Looks good, r=philipp.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: I've added another completeCheckServerInfo further above since calling request.responseStatus if there was some sort of request error causes it to throw.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: This is caught further above, but if we use it again here then we should break out earlier.

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: Pushed to comm-central <http://hg.mozilla.org/comm-central/rev/7e4da21b2924>

title: "(429126) Bugzilla Calendar - infinite loop at refresh when a calendar is deleted from the server outside of Lightning"
sen: -> FIXED

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: For some time (2 months? more?, i don't remember) i have this problem:

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: --> if i drag and drop a folder from a location to an other, cpu use for thunderbird process is more than 50%.

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: --> Even if the folder is empty

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: --> It occurs with subfolder move inside Local Folders

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: --> It occurs with folder move inside a pop account (for example moving Inbox->test to Draft->test

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: --> It DOESN'T occurs when moving a folder from a pop account to an other (for example moving AccoutA --> Inbox --> test to AccountB --> Inbox -->test ... Butin this case, by design, folder is copied, not moved --> it seems that this is

title: "(403907) Thunderbird - Moving (+ delete/rename) a folder/subfolder [...] take a lot of CPU and one to two minutes of processing"
sen: the delete which is the problem

sen: In KDE 3, Alt+Shift+Tab is one of the possible shortcuts used for switching keyboard layouts (keyboard layout kcm -> xkb options -> layout switching tree item).

title: "(153211) KDE - Keyboard didn\'t respond anymore after I press Alt+Shift+Tab"
sen: In particular Alt+Shift+Tab creates a Qt key sequence of Alt+Shift+Backtab and seemingly Alt+Print creates Alt+Shift+Print in Qt key sequence.

sen: Along with having a 'Find Usage' feature wich produce a list of places in the project like the 'Grep' do, is would be very nice to have an 'Hightlight Usage' feature wich is just hightlight the usage of a function or a variable in the currect file only and do not produce any windows.

sen: OS:                Linux

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: In amarok2-svn I like the the new contextview , but I found the new bottom bar for managing applets annoying , as it covers parts of other applets sometimes , like lyrics one , so that you miss a part of it.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Could be handy to have it appear and desappear onmouseover.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: thanks

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The real solution is to make it not cover applets, not make it appear/disappear on mouse over.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: i dont understand your point, dan... how do we make it not cover applets?

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Thats your problem to solve :)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The toolbar should be like the panel in kde, it gets it's own area to draw in (a strut in window manager terms).

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The applets should not consider the space the toolbar takes up to be theirs to play in, but rather end at the top of it.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: well if i move a window on my desktop down, the panel does cover it.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: so i still don't understand...

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: right, but new windows placed on the desktop do not get placed under the panel, and maximizing windows doesn't put them under the panel either.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: You need to explicitely place the window under the panel, and I considder it a bug that it's possible (but that's not what this debate is about).]

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The panel should not obfuscate applets by default.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: I fully agree with Dan here, and I also fully admit that I don't have the slightest clue on how to implement this technically :)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: But I really think that what he wrote makes a lot of sense, if feasible.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Me and Dan are meaning this.. a screen is better then words sometimes :-)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: i know what it looks like, 've been staring at it all day. btw, that screenshot is outdated now :)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: i still don't see how else you guys plan to visualize it.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: do you just want a border for the applet area, so instead of hitting the panel directly, it ends at the border?

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: i mean, applets *will* be logically under the location of the panel---all the applets that a user can  have will not fit on the screen at the same time---so how else to show it?

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The applet should end where the toolbar begins.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Applets should not be larger than the viewable area, if there's an applet above it, then the lower applet should get a smaller sizehint, and resize if necessary when it's the active applet (and therefore the only one on the screen)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Basically, no applet should continue on off the screen, it should end at the panel.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: i disagree :) what you are describing is a very different use-case of the CV in general, and distinctly different from what the original idea that was developed.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: in fact, i think there is another bug where we've already had this discussion (with mark), and this has come up on IRC.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: anyway, this is not something to be fixed, but rather a change that needs to be discussed with people like e.g. leinir.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: regardless of all of this, the problem of \"applets falling off the end of the screen\" should be mitigated when we are able to resize applets.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: You can't tell me that the screenshot attached to this bug is intended.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: There is no way to see the final line or two in the lyrics applet.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: This is a major bug.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: The bug that is being shown here is the fact that you cannot yet resize your applets, and as such we also don't set default sizes sanely.

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: You are reporting a bug on a non-completed feature ;)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: infact it was a wish! ;-)

title: "(188311) KDE - The applet panel should not overlap applets "
sen: Of course :) Just thought i should point out that the feature is not yet completed - the polish that's gone into it Ù…ately could seem like an indication of feature completion, and as such it would seem the prudent course to inform you Ùhat that is not the case :)

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: Version:           0.9.0 (using KDE 3.3.0, Gentoo)

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: Compiler:          gcc version 3.3.3 20040412 (Gentoo Linux 3.3.3-r6, ssp-3.3.2-2, pie-8.7.6)

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: OS:                Linux (i686) release 2.6.8-gentoo-r3

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: Since Kopete is a multimessenger and has the idea of metacontacts etc I don't think it's neccessary to display on which network the contact is online (because it doesn't matter), this makes even more sense if you have people who have several different accounts and irc nicks and keeping track of all of them can quite clutter the contact list, so I would simply like an option to turn of the displaying of the tiny icq/irc/etc icons right (or wherever you choose them to be) of the display name, hope this will be done any time soon, thanks for kopete it's such a great app!

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: I'd like an option to do exactly the OPPOSITE ! :-)

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: In fact, the contact list is organised as [KopeteStatusIcon][ContactName][ProtocolIcon].

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: Well, I'd like a way to tell Kopete to display only [ProtocolIcon][ContactName].

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: In fact, the best way would be to allow a CSS customisation of the contact list, just as we can have in message windows :-)

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: I am already considering adding that feature for the next version of Kopete; there are no technical or technological problems preventing it.

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "
sen: However, there may not be time to implement it before KDE3.4.

title: "(88340) KDE - disable displaying of status icons of contacts "

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: Martin

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: Right, so you are looking for an 'Align' action.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: This is more of a 'wishlist' since Kate doesn't really have this (see below).

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: It has unconditional indent left and right.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: If you want hello2 to move left go to Tools and hit 'Unindent' which will move it left to the tab stop.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: If you 'Indent' it will move to position 16, the next tab stop to the right.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: You can alternatively try 'Clean Indentation' and see if that aligns the misaligned blocks of code for you.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: It will even out the misaligned blocks of code most of the time if it can.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: *** Bug 71479 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: *** Bug 75951 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: This is available in cvs.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: Currently it works only if you use the 'cstyle' auto-indenter.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: The default shortcut is CTRL + TAB (controlled tab) and will align the current line OR the block of text you select according to normal c/c++ conventions.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: See also bug 40656 for further information and a warning.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "

"(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: In this case the second condition should be aligned with the first one, not according to normal stuff.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "

"(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
"(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
"(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
sen: In this case the closing parenthesis should be aligned with the opening one.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "

sen: Parameter lists are aligned just like you expect but it needs a reference character in the 'int foo (' line to judge what col to align to after that.

title: "(66526) KDE - Indentation mode to align line to code structure "
